issues.text: Whether clause (d) of Section 2(1) of the U.P. Urban Area Zamindari Abolition and Land Reforms Act, 1956 is violative of Articles 14, 19(1)(f) and 31 of the Constitution?

anchor.surface_text: The first argument of Shri Garg is that the lease involved in these cases was a lease for the purpose of erecting buildings and that accordingly it falls within the purview of cl. d of sub-section 1 of s. 2 of the Act. It is urged that cl. d is violative of Articles 14, 19 and 31 of the Constitution and is invalid.

issues.text: Whether Section 2(1)(d) of the Act is connected with agricultural reforms and thus protected by Article 31A from challenge under Articles 14, 19 and 31?

anchor.surface_text: The Act as a whole is protected by Article 31A of the Constitution. Shri Gargs contention, however, is that as s. 2 1 d is number at all connected with agricultural reforms, it cannot receive the protection of Article 31A and will be open to challenge for violation of Articles 14, 19 and 31.

issues.text: Whether 'agricultural area' under Section 2(1)(d) is limited to lands actually used for agriculture, horticulture or pasture on the relevant date, even if leased for erecting buildings?

anchor.surface_text: In terms S. 2 1 d does number appear to be connected with the object of agricultural reform. But a close scrutiny of its context and the object of the Act would reveal that it is so connected. All other clauses of s. 2 1 except cl. d , are clearly connected with the object of agricultural reform.

issues.text: Whether the disputed plot is an agricultural area under Section 2(1) and was being used for agriculture or horticulture on the relevant date?
Whether the suits and second appeals should abate under Rule 39 pending the determination of agricultural area status under the Act?

anchor.surface_text: The appeals are also allowed. The orders of the High Court abating the appeals and the suits are set aside. The High Court will restore the appeals and the suits to their original numbers.

holdings.text: Section 2(1)(d) of the U.P. Urban Area Zamindari Abolition and Land Reforms Act, 1956, though apparently expressed in wide language, is limited to lands which are on the relevant date being used for growing crops or as grove or as pasture land. It does not apply to lands which are not being so used.

anchor.surface_text: Having regard to the context already pointed out and this object of the Act it seems to us that s. 2  1   d , though apparently expressed in wide language, is limited to lands which, are on the relevant date being used for growing crops or as grove or as pasture land. It does

holdings.reasoning_summary: Harmonious construction with s.17(1)(b), context of other clauses, avoidance of anomaly, ordinary meaning of agriculture, preamble object, legislative history confirms limitation to actual agricultural use.

holdings.text: On this construction of s. 2(1)(d) it cannot be said that this provision is not connected with agricultural reforms. It would accordingly receive the protection of Art. 31A and would be immune from attack on the ground of violation of Articles 14, 19 and 31.

anchor.surface_text: We have come to the same conclusion though for different reasons. On this construction of s. 2  1   d  it cannot be said that this provision is number connected with agricultural reforms. It would accordingly receive the protection of Art. 31A and would be

holdings.reasoning_summary: Narrow interpretation links clause to agricultural reform object, attracting Art.31A protection against constitutional challenges.

holdings.text: The writ petition is allowed and the Government notification under s. 8 of the Act dated June 16, 1964 with respect to the land in dispute is quashed. The Government is directed to proceed afresh with respect to the land in dispute in accordance with ss. 3, 4, 5 and 8 of the Act.
holdings.reasoning_summary: Inadequate factual determination in counter-affidavit and commissioner's report; requires fresh inquiry under demarcation provisions.

holdings.text: It is not possible to express any concluded opinion on the question whether the land in dispute was an agricultural area on the date specified under s. 2(1) and was being used for horticulture. The issue should be decided afresh by the appropriate authority under the Act.
holdings.reasoning_summary: Commissioner's report and counter-affidavit insufficient for conclusive finding; factual dispute requires fresh determination.

holdings.text: The appeals are allowed. The orders of the High Court abating the appeals and the suits are set aside. The High Court will restore the appeals and the suits to their original numbers. The appeals will be decided on merits when the appropriate authority under s. 5 of the Act has held that the land in dispute is not an agricultural area.

anchor.surface_text: in the result, we allow the writ petition and quash the Government numberification under s. 8 of the Act, dated June 16, 1964 with respect to the land in dispute. We direct the Government to proceed afresh with respect to the land in dispute in accordance

holdings.reasoning_summary: Abatement premature pending fresh demarcation and determination under the Act; restore for decision post-authority's finding.

precedents.citation: Durga Prasad versus Board of Revenue U.P. Allahabad and others, 1

anchor.surface_text: In Durga Prasad versus Board of Revenue U.P. Allahabad and others, 1 the Allahabad High Court has pointed out this history of cl. d . The High Court has taken the view that s. 2 1   d  is limited to lands which are being used for agricultural purposes. We have come to the same conclusion though for different reasons. On this construction of s. 2  1   d  it cannot be said that this provision is not connected with agricultural reforms.

If land found to be agricultural area used for agriculture or horticulture on relevant date, Government may issue notification under s. 8.
If not agricultural area, no notification under s. 8.
High Court to restore appeals and suits to original numbers.
High Court to decide appeals on merits if land held not agricultural area, or dispose in accordance with Act if notification issued.
